result.execSummary:
The defendant Rayven E Stanisch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit to be determined.
01/20/2017 PER COURT AND STATE, DEFENDANT IS GRANTED 35 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT.

miscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts  for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions. Sign releases.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Obtain GED/HSED. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  *No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber) Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: (Fax) Dated 01/26/17, from Atty Penegor, giving notice he has no objections to a total of 35 days for presentence credit.

Dated January 18, 2017, from DDA Boese, in response to Atty Penegor's request for presentence credit. The state disputes that credit.   Sent to Judge Carter for review.

01/20/17,   per Judge Carter: proceed with adding 35 days credit on this JOC.

Dated 01/12/17, from Atty Penegor, requesting 81 days of sentence credit. Supporting documents attached.

01/20/17,   per Judge Carter: proceed with adding 35 days credit on this JOC.

Defendant Rayven E Stanisch in court with Attorney Robert J Penegor.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Barry Braatz and Leslie Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Elaine S. makes statements.  Attorney Penegor makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:    IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

5  YEARS IMPRISONMENT     (CREDIT - held open - Attorney Penegor to submit calculation)
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  30 MONTHS  -  Transfer allowed to Washington County 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling - obtain HSED/GED
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
____No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).


BUY MONEY:  $110.00 to Waukesha Metro Drug Unit  (payable to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office) - to be paid out of cash bail posted on this case

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surchage  (to be paid out of cash bail posted on this case and case #16CF190 - remainder to be refunded to poster)

CONDITION TIME:  90 Days,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED -  to be used at agent's discretion

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant must follow through with residential treatment at United Community Center and sign releases to confirm to the court that she is there.  Defendant is to be released to Elaine Stanisch (grandmother).

Defendant Rayven E Stanisch in court, in custody, with Attorney Robert J Penegor.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Penegor makes statements regarding bail motion.  State makes statements.  Court modifies cash bail.  Previous court date set remains on.
(Fax) ... for reduction of bail. Filed by Atty Penegor.
Sentencing hearing on January 11, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Rayven E Stanisch in court, in custody, with Attorney Robert J Penegor.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for bail motion hearing.  Attorney Penegor makes statements regarding motion.  Defendant's grandmother, Elaine Stanisch, makes statements.  Court denies request.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing on November 2, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Rayven E Stanisch in court, in custody, with attorney Robert J Penegor.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for Bail Motion hearing. Attorney Penegor requests modification of bail. State would object to any modification of bail at this time. Court will not modify bail at this time, but will set over for further bail motion for Attorney Penegor to provide more information.   Court orders that Attorney Penegor be provided access to the Defendant's personal property at the jail, and that the Defendant have immediate access to medical attention. Bail remains as fixed.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 2, 2017 at 11:00 am.
(Fax) ... for reduction of bail. Filed by Atty Penegor.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Rayven E Stanisch in court, in custody.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears without an Attorney due to time lapse in representation. Warrant is quashed based on the Defendant's appearance.  Defendant states that she has spoken to the PD's office and an Attorney will be appointed. The State requests cash bail. Defendant makes statement in regard to bail. Court sets cash bail at $5000.00, previous conditions will apply. Court will reset for a short hearing for Attorney Penegor to be contacted regarding cases.  Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.
